Audit Finding Resolution Description: Audit of NARA'S Preservation Program June 2005.  This report identified the need for NARA to develop a system that would document items needing preservation, consistently apply criteria for assessing preservation needs, and accurately track preservation performance measures.
Published Agency Strategic Performance P: Preserving the Past to Protect the Future, The Strategic Plan of the National Archives and Records Administration, 2006-2016 (revised 2009) - Strategic Goal 2: We will preserve and process records to ensure access by the public as soon as legally possible.
Other Requirement Description: OIG Semiannual Report to Congress.

Legislative Mandate Description: The National Archives and Records Administration was established by act of October 19, 1984 (44 U.S.C. 2101 et seq.), effective April 1, 1985, as an independent agency in the executive branch of the Government. From 2008 Revision Basic Laws and Authorities of the National Archives and Records Administration, 2006 Edition:. The following authorities apply to the National Archives: Federal Register (44 USC Chapter 15); National Archives and Records Administration (44 USC, Chapter 21), Presidential Records (44 USC Chapter 22), Trust Fund (44 USC Chapter 23), NHPRC (44 USC Chapter 25); Records of Congress( 44 USC Chapter 27); Records Management NARA/GSA (44 USC Chapter 31); Records Management/Federal Agencies (44 USC Chapter 31); Disposal of Records (44 USC Chapter 33).
Audit Finding Resolution Description: 1) Electronic Records Archive:  National Archives Needs to Strengthen its Capacity to use Earned Value Techniques to Manage and Oversee Development.2) Electronic Government: National Archives and Records Administration s Fiscal Year 2011 Expenditure Plan.3) National Archives: Progress and Risks in Implementing its Electronic Records Archive Initiative.4) Electronic Records Archive: The National Archives and Records Administration's Fiscal Year 2009 Expenditure Plan.5) OIG Semiannual Report to Congress.6) Advisory Report No. 09-03, OIG Monitoring Electronic Records Archives Program Status.7) Advisory Report No. 09-11, OIG Monitoring Electronic Records Archives Program Status.
Published Agency Strategic Performance P: Preserving the Past to Protect the Future, The Strategic Plan of the National Archives and Records Administration, 2006-2016 (revised 2009) - Strategic Goal 3: We will address the challenges of electronic records in Government to ensure success in fulfilling NARA's mission in the digital era; Strategic Goal 4: We will provide prompt, easy, and secure access to our holdings anywhere, anytime.

- Strategic Goal 2: Ensures that NARA staff continue to have access to a system that allows them to describe the holdings at the appropriate level and quality in a centralized system, and that the public has quick and easy access to the new and updated descriptions. - Strategic Goal 4: Ensures that NARA staff continues to have access to a system that allows them to describe the holdings at the appropriate level and quality in a centralized system and provides access to digital copies of non-electronic records in a centralized, one-stop shop for NARA researchers. - Strategic Goal 6: Ensures that NARA staff can continue to enter original descriptions, upload descriptions from finding aids as well as those provided by NARA digitizing partners, and provide online access to all of those descriptions, so that the archival context of all our holdings is readily available.

Investment Title: IT Infrastructure, Office Automation and Telecommunications
Presidential Priority Description: NSF's transition to a DHS certified internet service provider supports the Trusted Internet Connection Initiative issued by OMB; NSF's transition of selected IT services to a commercial, cloud hosting environment supports federal priorities as articulated in OMB's 25 Point Plan to Reform Federal IT; NSF enabling Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) for internet traffic supports government-wide IPv6 adoption requirements; and NSF's planned transition to HSPD-12 logical smart card access for all NSF IT systems supports Homeland Security Presidential Directive 12.
Other Requirement Description: NA.

Audit Finding Resolution Description: Finding 09-06 Accounting for Transactions in NSF's Current Financial System. This finding was reported in Management Letters and was previously reported as a Significant Deficiency in the FY2007 Audit Report.
Published Agency Strategic Performance P: As part of NSF's Strategic Goal to Perform as a Model Organization, performance goal M-3 is Encourage and sustain a culture of creativity and innovation across the agency to ensure continuous improvement and achieve high levels of customer service.  NSF is committed to transitioning its financial processing of grants from a pooled system (quarterly reporting of expenditures by institution) to grant-by-grant (real-time reporting of expenditures by award) in FY 2013.  This change will have many advantages for both NSF and its grantees, such as better and more timely financial data and stronger recipient monitoring programs.  This is an essential aspect of establishing the capability to monitor expenditures at the award level as part of NSF's financial system modernization.

Legislative Mandate Description: NA.
Other Requirement Description: Circular A-127 prescribes policies and standards for executive departments and agencies to follow when managing their financial management systems.

Legislative Mandate Description: Research.gov's Project Outcomes Report fulfills the America COMPETES Act requirement to make outcomes of NSF-funded research publicly available.  In addition, modern IT services are essential to the grant-making process and thus are essential to fulfilling NSF's statutory mission to promote the progress of science-  The Proposal & Award Policies & Procedures Guide (PAPPG) was updated to require the Primary Place of Performance be stated to meet the Federal Funding Accountability & Transparency Act (FFATA) requirements.
Published Agency Strategic Performance P: NSF's Fiscal Year 2011-2016 Strategic Plan includes the Strategic Goal Perform as a Model Organization, which Research.gov is helping to accomplish by improving access to federally-funded research information and by providing innovative online tools to improve the interaction between government agencies and research institutions.  In addition, Research.gov helps meet the NSF Strategic Goal Innovate for Society by providing new and innovative tools to help educate and inform policymakers and the public about the outcomes and impacts of NSF-funded research.
Other Requirement Description: The Federal Financial Report (FFR), as part of NSF's post-award administration activities, meets the government-wide requirement for quarterly Grantee financial reporting. NSF's Research Performance Progress Report (RPPR) also meets government-wide requirements, providing grantees with the capability to complete and submit the RPPR, in addition to showing the status of the reports.

Legislative Mandate Description: To fulfill an America COMPETES Act (ACA) requirement, ACA Mentoring Plan Enhancements were made to FastLane, eJacket and Grants.gov to enforce submission by PIs and SPOs and aid Program Office Staff in review. A new ACA Project Outcomes Report, available for the general public, also supports the ACA requirement to make outcomes of NSF-funded research publicly available. The Proposal & Awards Policies & Procedures Guide (PAPPG) was also updated to include a Data Management Plan and to eliminate voluntary committed Cost Sharing in proposals per ACA requirements, as well as to require the Primary Place of Performance be stated to meet the Federal Funding Accountability & Transparency Act (FFATA) requirements.

IRS ERDS is Federally Regulated through 10 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 50.72.A.4, which states that the licensee must activate ERDS within one hour after the licensee declares an emergency at an emergency class level of alert or higher (higher means the declaration of a site area emergency or general emergency).
Published Agency Strategic Performance P: Safety: Ensure adequate protection of public health and safety and the environment.  Security: Ensure adequate protection in the secure use and management of radioactive materials.
Strategic Plan - Organizational Excellence - Financial Management and Procurement.

Investment Title: Agencywide Documents Access and Management System (ADAMS)
Legislative Mandate Description: Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 (44 U.S.C. 3501 et seq.); National Archives and Records Administration regulations at 36 CFR Subchapter B, Records Management, Parts 1220-1238 and 44 U.S.C. Chapter 31, Records Management by Federal Agencies.
Published Agency Strategic Performance P: NRC Published Agency Strategic Plan - Provide proactive information management and information technology services to enable staff and stakeholders to better access and use needed information.
Other Requirement Description: OMB's regulations at 5 CFR 1320,Controlling Paperwork Burdens on the Public.

Legislative Mandate Description: Federal Managers Financial Integrity Act.
Published Agency Strategic Performance P: Strategic Plan - Organizational Excellence - Financial Management and Procurement.
Other Requirement Description: Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1990 Nuclear Waste Policy Act of 1982.

Legislative Mandate Description: Public Law 101-508, Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1990(OBRA-90), as amended, and the Independent Offices Appropriation Act of 1952(IOAA) mandates that the NRC recover a percentage of its costs of operation from the users of its services. One of the functional areas of (FAIMIS) CFS-R is License Fee Billing. CFO Act 1990 mandates that agency CFOs are to develop and maintain agency financial mgmt systems that comply with: applicable accounting principles, standards, and requirements, internal control standards, requirements of OMB, the Dept of the Treasury, and others. OMB Circular A-136, Financial Reporting Requirements, requires agencies to report costs by major program on the Statement of Net Cost in the annual financial statements. The allocation methodology adopted at NRC for the Statement of Net Cost is consistent with cost principles contained in Statement of Federal Financial Accounting Stds (SFFAS) Number 4, Managerial Cost Accounting Concepts and Stds for the Federal Gov.
Audit Finding Resolution Description: The legacy Fees System relied on external mitigating controls to address numerous audit findings related to IT General Controls Access Controls and Security Management until replaced by FAIMIS.
Published Agency Strategic Performance P: Strategic Plan: Fiscal Years 2008-2013 (NUREG-1614, Volume 4) Organizational Excellence/Operational Excellence Accurate and timely financial information is another component of operational excellence and is critical to enabling agency managers to achieve the NRC s safety and security goals while efficiently using resources. Quality financial information enhances the effectiveness of agency managerial decisions and has the potential to reduce the fees borne by licensees, as well as the public s tax burden..
Strategic Plan - Organizational Excellence - operational excellence strategy (Information Management and Information Technology).
We directly support the NRC Goal of Organizational excellence.

Legislative Mandate Description: Establishment of the ISMP is required under the Energy Policy Act of 2005. The NSTS component specifically addresses the need to provide a web-based, full life cycle tracking of individual sealed sources containing nuclear materials and it directly supports the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) mission areas of nuclear materials safety and security of radioactive material.
Audit Finding Resolution Description: Actions Taken by NRC to Strengthen Its Licensing Process for Sealed Radioactive Sources Are Not Effective - http://www.gao.gov/new.items/d071038t.pdf; NRC and DHS Need to Take Additional Steps to Better Track and Detect Radioactive Materials - http://www.gao.gov/new.items/d08598.pdf.The WBL and LVS components of ISMP specifically address issues documented by the Government Accountability Office (GAO) in 2007. These systems along with the source information stored in NSTS provide a way for licensees nationwide to confirm the license validity of other licensees seeking to obtain radioactive materials.
Published Agency Strategic Performance P: U.S. NRC Strategic Plan Fiscal Years 2008-2013; This investment directly supports NRC's Safety Goal and NRC's Security Goal by ensuring adequate protection in the secure use and management of radioactive materials. (P41-429-002: Prevent instances where licensed radioactive materials are used domestically in a manner hostile to the United States.).
Other Requirement Description: SECY-07-0147 - Response to U.S. Government Accountability Office Recommendations And Other Recommendations To Address Security Issues In The U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission Materials Program.

Published Agency Strategic Performance P: Strategic Plan: Fiscal Years 2008-2013 (NUREG-1614, Volume 4) Organizational Excellence/Operational Excellence Accurate and timely financial information is another component of operational excellence and is critical to enabling agency managers to achieve the NRC s safety and security goals while efficiently using resources. Quality financial information enhances the effectiveness of agency managerial decisions and has the potential to reduce the fees borne by licensees, as well as the public s tax burden..
